data.text:
26th of March 2012

The Singapore high conmenser came to our school.There were also perfomance by the Cadets Police and the school band.

12th of March 2012

Bandar Seri Begawan – Chung Hwa Middle School (CHMS), Bandar Seri Begawan, yesterday held a walkathon in conjunction with the 90th anniversary of the establishment of the school.

The walkathon is organised once every two years for fund raising and to encourage a healthy lifestyle.

The guest of honour was Dato Seri Setia Awg Haji Yusoff bin Hj Ismail, Deputy Minister of Education.

The Chairman of CHMS’s Board of Directors, Tan San Leong, in a speech said, “Chung Hwa Middle School is a private school which does not depend on benefits.

Likewise, the objective of organising the walkathon event is to collect funds for the school’s development.

Besides that, about $3,000 from the collection will be donated to Pengiran Muda Mahkota Al-Muhtadee Billah Fund for Orphans as social responsibility of the school.”

The walkathon began with an aerobics session for warming up and stretching.

The participants walked for about four kilometres and after the walkathon, there was a tree planting ceremony, followed by the presentation of donation to Pengiran Muda Mahkota Al-Muhtadee Billah Fund for Orphans by Tan San Leong to the guest of honour.

Later certificates and prizes were presented for top teachers, sponsors and students.

Also present were Permenant Secretary at the Ministry of Education (Core Education) Awg Haji Mahrub bin Haji Murni, and Committee of Chung Hwa Middle School.

27th of February 2012

Kuala Belait – Top scorers Ang Chorng Kae from Chung Hwa Middle School BSB and Kuncheria Thomas from Chung Hwa Kuala Belait recently won a bond-free scholarship from the prestigious Hwa Chong International School, Singapore (HCIS), opening the door to pursue a two-year International Baccalaureate Diploma in the republic.

Chorng Kae’s achievement again attests to the consistent success of Chung Hwa Middle School, BSB in producing well-rounded students with excellent academic performance. He is the second student to receive the scholarship after his senior Tong Yee Eng, the first recipient from Brunei last year.

According to a press release, a briefing was held at the school conference room on February 22 to cast more light on the particular of the course, the scholarship and education system in Singapore. The briefing was co-hosted by the principal of Hwa Chong International School Mr Koh Chin Nguang and two of his vice principals.

Witnessed by Mr Tan San Leona as the chairman of the school Board of Directors in Chung Hwa Middle School BSB, principal Mr Kho Guik Lan, deputy principal Mr Beh Hai ‘Yau and principal of Chung Hwa KB, the briefing also entailed a sharing session between Hwa Chong and the parents.

The representatives of Hwa Chong International School also took the opportunity to conduct interviews with prospective students in Brunei.

Five more students were recruited to enrol in the school’s programme after the interview.

The principal Mdm Kho Guik Lan congratulated Ang Chorng Kae and highlighted that Ang’s success adds another feather in the school’s cap. She also expressed her gratitude to Mr Koh Chin Nguang for his trust and support to Chung Hwa students who are all set to reach dizzying heights in Singapore.

Hwa Chong International School, a member of Hwa Chong family schools, started its operation in 2005. It offers a six-year through-train programme from Grade 7 to Grade 12. It offers an International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme.

It is a renowned institution committed to offering a unique paradigm for learning that nurtures its students into independent, innovative and internationalised global citizens for successful enterprise in the public and private sector

7th of March 2012

Bandar Seri Begawan – The Kindergarten Class of Chung Hwa BSB decorated the exhibition hall with national flags and other symbols of the country to add gaiety to its celebration of National Day recently.

In the month of February, the class exuded an ambience of patriotism as teachers and students busied themselves with preparing hand-made national flags and maps of Brunei.

The teachers also took the opportunity to educate students on the importance of respecting the national flag.

With flag in hand, the future leaders of Brunei later walked around the school declaring their love for the country.

Assistant Principal Sim Man Ling highlighted that the annual celebration is aimed at helping students understand the importance of Independence Day.

“We have to teach our children from a young age so they will appreciate the nation and contribute to its development in the future,” she concluded.

The celebration at the school started as early as the day before National Day, where the preschoolers were briefed on respecting the national flag and also taught the national anthem

23th of February 2012

Bandar Seri Begawan – The recently released ‘0 Level examination results have shown that the students of Chung Hwa Middle School in the capital again made the school proud as they passed the public examinations with flying colours.

Of the school’s top scorers, Ang Chorng Kae, Lowell Lee Tuan Lun, Leong Suk Chin and Isabella Lau Kar Lye topped the charts with 9As. Five students scored 8As while 14 students scored 7As.

The school was delighted by the overall improvement notably in Physics where all its students scored a credit or above; and in Additional Maths and Chemistry where 98.6 per cent scored a credit or above.

English subject also recorded a marked improvement of 9.2 per cent as 71.8 per cent of its students scored a credit and above.

The school also achieved 100-per-cent passing rate in Additional Maths, Physics and Biology.

The Principal, Madam Kho Guik Lan was impressed by the remarkable achievements of her students.

“The success is due to the resolute effort of teachers and all students who go all out to attain perfection under a good school environment conducive for learning,” she said.

She also thanked the school’s board of directors for their support in developing the hardware and software of the school.

In conjunction with the schools 90th anniversary, the school Board of Directors spares no expenses in providing the best learning facilities in tandem with the school’s ultimate objective to mould well-rounded multilingual talent under the national education philosophy.

“Credit should also be given to parents for their support to the school,” she concluded

24th of April 2010

Students from Chinese schools nationwide yesterday showcased their talents and skills for the Chinese Drama Competition held at Chung Hwa Middle School in the capital.

The primary school section was participated by Chung Ling School in Sungai Liang, Chung Hwa School in Tutong, Chung Hwa School in Bandar Seri Begawan, Pei Yuk School in Temburong, Chung Hwa School in Labi, Chung Hwa School in Kiudang and Chung Ching School in Seria.

Chung Hwa School BSB, Chung Ching in Seria, Chung Hwa in Kuala Belait competed in the secondary school section.

The event’s chief guest was Mr Ting Tiu Pheng, who also presented the winners with their prizes. Also present were their parents and relatives who came to give their respective children some moral support.

Participating students acted out dramas based on several titles, such as “Butterfly”, “Stars”, “Lost in the Forest”, “Brotherhood”, “The Most Happiest Thing in Life”, “When We were in School” and “Community”.

The contest’s objective was to enhance their knowledge on creativity and skills, as well as interactions. It also provided them platform and exposure, while instilling in them self-confidence and teaching them all about public speaking in front of an audience.
